repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Lines to/from which virt_lines or inline virt_text may have
          moved are left valid. Similarly the modified region may be
          too small to account for moved decorations after inserting
          or deleting lines. `redrawOneLine()` can be replaced with
          a call to `changed_lines_redraw_buf()`.
Solution: Invalidate the line after a change if there is virt_lines, or
          inline virt_text in the buffer with 'wrap' enabled. Extend the
          modified region for inserted or deleted lines if there may be
          decorations in the buffer. Remove `redrawOneLine()`.
          Simplify the logic for `changed_lines_invalidate_win()`.

Fix #27369
Fix #27370

comment_data.body: This doesn't look correct. `lnume` is already the line below the change as mentioned in the doc comment above.

It didn't look right to me either but "it" in the comment should be `buf->b_mod_bot`. You'll find that when you delete line 1, currently both `buf->b_mod_top` _and_ `buf->b_mod_bot` are set to 1. That is wrong according to
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c73a827564083b4dadb3a70468466306fb416d08/src/nvim/drawscreen.c#L1574

Commenting out this line results in a failure in `decorations_spec.lua`.
How is that wrong? The lines that need changes have been deleted, so no lines need changes.

It's wrong because it results in missing lines. How many lines need to be scrolled is also determined from `mod_top/bot`, not just which lines need to actually be redrawn. It seems that `mod_bot` should still be set to the line _after_ `mod_top`. If `mod_top == mod_top`, `win_update()` may compute the old size for `mod_top` but not the new size, because `l < mod_bot` is never true in this loop:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c73a827564083b4dadb3a70468466306fb416d08/src/nvim/drawscreen.c#L2187-L2200

Ensuring that `mod_bot` is larger than `mod_top` in this case does not result in any more calls to `win_line()`, but it does resolve the problem seen in #33358.
What missing lines? The test failure is caused by the movement of extmarks, so the condition here should be related to extmarks. I was previously trying to solve this in #27453
The lines that are deleted by the scroll logic in #33358.

> so the condition here should be related to extmarks

I took another stab at this, mostly just finding the condition that works with your test I added from #27453 and the repro from #33358. Then writing the comments around those conditions, whether they actually make sense I'm not sure...
But yeah I missed, or forgot about #27453. If the accuracy of that approach is preferred, and you intend to pick that back up, we can close this or reduce it to just the refactor part.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -186,6 +186,15 @@ static void changed_lines_invalidate_win(win_T *wp, linenr_T lnum, colnr_T col,
     approximate_botline_win(wp);
   }
 
+  // If lines haven been inserted/deleted and the buffer has virt_lines, or
+  // inline virtual text with 'wrap' is enabled, invalidate the line after the
+  // changed lines as some virt_lines may now be drawn above a different line,
+  // or cause another line to wrap.

comment_data.body: When `xtra > 0 && buf_meta_total(buf, kMTMetaLines)`, also need to increase `lnume` by `1`.
`lnume` doesn't need to increase when adding lines (`xtra > 0`) with inline virtual text but no virtual lines.
Yeah that's what I had initially, but couldn't bring into words the reasoning behind this distinction for a positive and negative xtra so wanted to first find a testcase for it.

With negative `xtra` extmarks in the deleted lines may move to a different line. With positive `xtra` this doesn't happen, but virtual lines from extmarks that are not moved may be now displayed above the first added line.

> so the condition here should be related to extmarks

But since left gravity marks can move from the line beyond the change as you found in #27369, I think this is basically needed for any kind of decoration. The most restrictive (but too eager) condition we have available for that right now would be something like `buf->b_marktree->n_keys > 0`.

```suggestion
  it('redraws the line from which a left gravity mark has moved #27369', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3033,6 +3033,21 @@ describe('extmark decorations', function()
     feed('<C-E><C-Y>')
     eq(5, n.fn.line('w0'))
   end)
+
+  it('redraws the line from which a right_gravity mark has moved #27369', function()

comment_regular_data.body: This resolves https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33361#issuecomment-2781689543. I.e. with this patch applied but cf59631f reverted, there is no apparent problem when trying to reproduce #33358.

title: fix(marks): wrong display after inserting/deleting lines
